title: Abu Dhabi's ADNOC to acquire German chemicals firm Covestro for $16.4 billion
content: Abu Dhabi's state oil firm ADNOC announced it will buy German firm Covestro in a 14.7 billion-euro deal ($16.4 billion).
summary: Abu Dhabi's state oil firm ADNOC announced it will buy German firm Covestro in a 14.7 billion-euro deal ($16.4 billion).

title: London-based Robinhood rival Freetrade buys UK arm of Australian investing platform Stake
content: British retail investing app Freetrade has entered into an agreement with Australian rival Stake to take on all of the company's U.K. clients and their assets.
summary: British retail investing app Freetrade has entered into an agreement with Australian rival Stake to take on all of the company's U.K. clients and their assets.

title: Chinese EV brands Li Auto and Zeekr report record deliveries for September
content: Nio, BYD, Xiaomi and Aito, co-developed by Huawei, had yet to release September deliveries as of Tuesday afternoon.
summary: Nio, BYD, Xiaomi and Aito, co-developed by Huawei, had yet to release September deliveries as of Tuesday afternoon.

title: European markets kick off October trading on a high note; euro zone inflation data in focus
content: European stocks kicked off October trading in positive territory after ending September on a somber note.
summary: European stocks kicked off October trading in positive territory after ending September on a somber note.

title: East and Gulf Coast ports strike, with ILA longshoremen walking off job from New England to Texas, stranding billions in trade
content: ILA union longshoremen at East Coast, Gulf Coast ports walk off the job after ownership and labor failed to reach a deal in a blow to the U.S. economy.
summary: ILA union longshoremen at East Coast, Gulf Coast ports walk off the job after ownership and labor failed to reach a deal in a blow to the U.S. economy.

title: Cybersecurity firm Proofpoint considers pre-IPO funding as it plots a return to public markets
content: It would mark the second time Proofpoint has gone public after the company was acquired in 2021 by private equity firm Thoma Bravo for $12.3 billion.
summary: It would mark the second time Proofpoint has gone public after the company was acquired in 2021 by private equity firm Thoma Bravo for $12.3 billion.

title: Robinhood launches crypto transfers in Europe as it pushes overseas expansion
content: Retail investing platform Robinhood is setting sights on an EU expansion as part of broader plans to increase its global foothold.
summary: Retail investing platform Robinhood is setting sights on an EU expansion as part of broader plans to increase its global foothold.

title: 'Golden Week’ bookings show Chinese travel preferences are evolving
content: Bookings show that Chinese travelers are staying longer, traveling farther and looking for new experiences — from quiet destinations to K-pop concerts.
summary: Bookings show that Chinese travelers are staying longer, traveling farther and looking for new experiences — from quiet destinations to K-pop concerts.

title: Here’s why Japan’s stocks are plunging after Shigeru Ishiba’s win
content: Shigeru Ishida had beaten Economic Security Minister Sanae Takaichi in the final round of the Liberal Democratic Party election on Friday.
summary: Shigeru Ishida had beaten Economic Security Minister Sanae Takaichi in the final round of the Liberal Democratic Party election on Friday.

title: China's stock surge has echoes of the 2015 bubble. What's different this time
content: The rocket up in Chinese stocks so far looks different from the market bubble in 2015, analysts said.
summary: The rocket up in Chinese stocks so far looks different from the market bubble in 2015, analysts said.

title: Japan's next prime minister is a career dissenter, but experts doubt he can govern as one
content: While Japan's next leader, Shigeru Ishiba, has been an outsider and Abenomics critic, it will be challenging to govern that way, some experts say.
summary: While Japan's next leader, Shigeru Ishiba, has been an outsider and Abenomics critic, it will be challenging to govern that way, some experts say.

title: China's economic woes dampen 'Golden Week' holiday travel
content: Not only have flights been cheaper, data also indicates that travelers may be opting for lower cost transport options.
summary: Not only have flights been cheaper, data also indicates that travelers may be opting for lower cost transport options.

title: Asia-Pacific markets mixed after Powell signals smaller rate cuts; China markets closed for holiday
content: South Korea, Hong Kong and mainland Chinese markets are closed for a public holiday Tuesday.
summary: South Korea, Hong Kong and mainland Chinese markets are closed for a public holiday Tuesday.

title: 'No challenges can stop China's progress' Xi Jinping says in 75th anniversary speech
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping made no mention of specific countries or trade conflicts in his Monday speech and portrayed Beijing as upholding globalization.
summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping made no mention of specific countries or trade conflicts in his Monday speech and portrayed Beijing as upholding globalization.

title: Consumer companies vie for share of India's booming stock market
content: More consumer-facing companies in India are listing on India's stock exchanges, or have big plans to IPO in months to come.
summary: More consumer-facing companies in India are listing on India's stock exchanges, or have big plans to IPO in months to come.

title: Powell indicates further, smaller rate cuts, insists the Fed is 'not on any preset course'
content: The central bank chief asserted that he will seek to balance fighting inflation with supporting the labor market.
summary: The central bank chief asserted that he will seek to balance fighting inflation with supporting the labor market.

title: Iran's response to Israel will be a choice between revenge and survival. Markets say it's choosing survival
content: Iran's leadership has vowed revenge, but its actions and language suggest — at least so far — a more measured response.
summary: Iran's leadership has vowed revenge, but its actions and language suggest — at least so far — a more measured response.

title: Google to invest $1 billion in Thailand to build data center and accelerate AI growth
content: Google is investing 36 billion Thai baht, or $1 billion, into Thailand to build a new data center and expand its cloud infrastructure, the company said Monday.
summary: Google is investing 36 billion Thai baht, or $1 billion, into Thailand to build a new data center and expand its cloud infrastructure, the company said Monday.

title: China stocks just had their best day in 16 years, sending related U.S. ETFs soaring
content: The Shanghai Composite rallied 8.06% in its best day since September 2008.
summary: The Shanghai Composite rallied 8.06% in its best day since September 2008.

title: AI chipmaker Cerebras files for IPO to take on Nvidia
content: Cerebras faces competition from Nvidia, as well as cloud providers that have developed in-house chips for running artificial intelligence models.
summary: Cerebras faces competition from Nvidia, as well as cloud providers that have developed in-house chips for running artificial intelligence models.

title: German inflation drops to 1.8% in September, below expectations
content: The harmonized German consumer price index eased to 1.8% in September, more than expected, preliminary data from the country's statistics office showed Monday.
summary: The harmonized German consumer price index eased to 1.8% in September, more than expected, preliminary data from the country's statistics office showed Monday.

title: Oil markets not pricing in an 'all-out war' after Israel kills Hezbollah leader, but risks persist
content: Oil prices barely budged after Hezbollah confirmed that its leader was killed on Friday in an Israeli airstrike in the Lebanese capital of Beirut.
summary: Oil prices barely budged after Hezbollah confirmed that its leader was killed on Friday in an Israeli airstrike in the Lebanese capital of Beirut.

title: China stocks just saw their best day of trading since 2008 amid a stimulus rally
content: China's CSI 300 rallied 8.48%, closing at 4,017.85 for a nine-day winning streak, its best day since September 2008 and its highest point since August 2023.
summary: China's CSI 300 rallied 8.48%, closing at 4,017.85 for a nine-day winning streak, its best day since September 2008 and its highest point since August 2023.

title: China's factory activity contracts less than expected in September — but shrinks for a fifth straight month
content: The official manufacturing purchasing managers' index came in at 49.8, slightly beating the 49.5 expected among economists polled by Reuters.
summary: The official manufacturing purchasing managers' index came in at 49.8, slightly beating the 49.5 expected among economists polled by Reuters.

title: Stellantis and Aston Martin shares drop sharply after profit warnings amid China woes
content: Stocks of European carmakers hemorrhaged early on Monday as Stellantis and British luxury brand Aston Martin issued profit warnings.
summary: Stocks of European carmakers hemorrhaged early on Monday as Stellantis and British luxury brand Aston Martin issued profit warnings.

title: Rupert Murdoch’s property group REA ends chase to buy Rightmove after multiple rejected offers
content: Rupert Murdoch's Australian property listing firm REA Group said Monday it would no longer seek to buy UK property portal Rightmove.
summary: Rupert Murdoch's Australian property listing firm REA Group said Monday it would no longer seek to buy UK property portal Rightmove.

title: EchoStar to sell Dish to DirecTV, combining major pay-TV providers
content: EchoStar CEO Hamid Akhavan appeared on CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" on Monday after the company sold its video distribution business to DirecTV.
summary: EchoStar CEO Hamid Akhavan appeared on CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" on Monday after the company sold its video distribution business to DirecTV.

title: China property stocks rally after major cities ease homebuying restrictions
content: Shares of Chinese property developers rallied on Monday, fueled by easing homebuying measures, following authorities' blitz of policy stimulus last week.
summary: Shares of Chinese property developers rallied on Monday, fueled by easing homebuying measures, following authorities' blitz of policy stimulus last week.

title: 'Full force': Malaysia PM says crusade against corruption is not over as country courts investment
content: The Southeast Asian nation lost around 277 billion ringgit in economic output due to corruption from 2018 to 2023, according to official estimates.
summary: The Southeast Asian nation lost around 277 billion ringgit in economic output due to corruption from 2018 to 2023, according to official estimates.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Shiny September days for stocks
content: Stocks’ defiant showing this September was helped by positive sentiment generated by the U.S. Federal Reserve’s jumbo rate cut and upbeat economic data.
summary: Stocks’ defiant showing this September was helped by positive sentiment generated by the U.S. Federal Reserve’s jumbo rate cut and upbeat economic data.
